intro: Protium hostmannii var. brasiliense, commonly known as the Brazilian wild mace, is a tropical evergreen tree native to the Amazon rainforest. It belongs to the family Sapotaceae and is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and small, yellowish-green flowers. The plant produces a unique fruit that is covered in a spiny husk, containing a single seed. It is valued for its aromatic seeds, which are used in traditional medicine and as a spice. Due to habitat loss, it is considered endangered and requires conservation efforts to ensure its survival.
